meanings.definition: Tending to invade or intrude upon.
meanings.sent1: The incursive behavior of the new neighbor made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: Her incursive attitude towards others often led to conflicts.
meanings.sent3: The incursive squirrel kept sneaking into the bird feeder for snacks.
meanings.sent4: His incursive gaze seemed to pierce through all barriers.
meanings.sent5: The incursive storm clouds loomed ominously over the horizon.

meanings.sent1: The incursive dog growled fiercely at anyone who approached.
meanings.sent2: The team's incursive tactics intimidated their opponents.
meanings.sent3: The incursive cat hissed at the vacuum cleaner, thinking it was a threat.
meanings.sent4: Her words had an incursive impact, leaving a trail of hurt feelings.
meanings.sent5: The incursive thunder echoed through the valley, signaling a fierce storm.

meanings.definition: A type of handwriting characterized by a slanting, flowing style.
meanings.sent1: Her incursive handwriting was elegant and easy to read.
meanings.sent2: The teacher praised the student's neat incursive script.
meanings.sent3: The incursive letters danced across the page like graceful ballerinas.
meanings.sent4: His incursive signature stood out on the official document.
meanings.sent5: The old love letters were written in beautiful incursive, full of emotion.
